an5.205:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these five kinds of hard-heartedness.
an5.205:1.3: Firstly, a mendicant has doubts about the Teacher. They’re uncertain, undecided, and lacking confidence.
an5.205:1.4: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
an5.205:1.5: This is the first kind of hard-heartedness.
an5.205:2.1: Furthermore, a mendicant has doubts about the teaching …
an5.205:2.4: A mendicant is angry and upset with their spiritual companions, resentful and closed off.
an5.205:2.5: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
an5.205:2.6: This is the fifth kind of hard-heartedness.
an5.205:2.7: These are the five kinds of hard-heartedness.”
